title: Class Dismissed: The Improv 101 Grad Show
description:
Dust off those caps and gowns... because it's graduation time at the Push.

Check out the Push Comedy Theater's Improv 101 class as they show off their comedy chops.

You won't believe what these improv newcomers have in store for you!!!

Class Dismissed: The Improv 101 Graduation ShowTuesday, May 14th at 7pmTickets are $5

The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.

--

The Push Comedy Theater is a 99 seat venue in the heart of Norfolk's brand new Arts District. Founded by local comedy group The Pushers, the Push Comedy Theater is dedicated to bringing you live comedy from the best local and national acts. The Push Comedy Theater hosts will host live sketch and improv comedy on Friday and Saturday nights. During the week classes are offered in sketch writing, improv comedy and acting.

Whether you're a die-hard comedy lover or a casual fan... a seasoned performer or someone who's never stepped foot on stage... the Push Comedy Theater has something for you.

title: The First Timers Club: An SNL Style Comedy Show
description:
Get ready to laugh your butts off!!!

It's The First Timers Club: A Brand New Comedy Show from the minds of the Push Comedy Theater's Sketch Comedy Writing Class.

The writers of our Sketch 101 Writing Class have been working away... and they've come up with a kick-ass show!!!

Where else will you find a show with

-Salad Frosting

-A Garden Romance

-A Reading of Grandma's Will

-A Very Special Laundromat

-A Guys Night at the Movies

-A Brand New Boxing League

And a whole lot more!!!



Don't miss this hilarious show from some amazing first time writers...

The First Timers Club: A Sketch Comedy Show

Wednesday, September 11th

The show starts a 8pm

Tickets are $5



Push Comedy Theater

763 Granby Street

Norfolk, VA

757-333-7442

pushcomedytheater.com

The Pushers are very proud of this show. The students of our Sketch 101 writing class have been working their comedy butts off and we can’t wait for you to see their work. It’s some really funny stuff. Don’t miss it!!!

The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.

Free parking available at Slone Chiropractic (111 W Virginia Beach) just one block from the theater. There is also limited parking on the street and in the lot directly across from the theater.

title: Sketch Me Like One of Your French Girls Presents Resurrection
description:
Sketch Me Like One of Your French Girls proudly presents 
RESURRECTION.

Join us on an adventure as we try to bring back to life our recently deceased friend. We’re processing our grief by taking the laws of nature into our own hands.

Sketch Me Like One of Your French Girls is a sketch comedy group based out of Norfolk, VA. We’re a group of pals who write well together and really know how to pull off a beret.

Sketch Me Like One of Your French Girls presents Resurrection Thursday, September 12th at 8 PM at Push Comedy Theater. Tickets are $10

title: Girl-Prov Presents: Leave It To Beavers
description:
DON'T MISS LEAVE IT TO BEAVERS FINAL PERFORMANCE AT GIRL PROV

GirlProv is an all-female improv show, making audiences lose it with laughter at the Push Comedy Theater.

It's slumber party meets night out on the town meet sorority house party!

Don't miss this night of comedy- all made up on the spot from the audience's suggestion!

title: Teacher's Pet
description:
The Students Become The Masters!!!

Teachers and students will join forces for a good old fashioned improv jam!!!

Don't miss it! Some of the Push Comedy's Theater's funniest students share the stage with their teachers, The Pushers. Ordinarily we frown upon fraternization between teachers and students... but for one night only all bets are off!!!

Teachers Pet

Second Friday of the month at 10pm

Tickets are $5



The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.

title: The Unusual Suspects: An Improvised Murder Mystery
description:
Who Dunnit: The Improvised Murder Mystery is now The Unusual Suspects... new name, same great show.

The hottest show in the history of the 757 is NOW A NATIONALLY TOURING SHOW!

The Unusual Suspects

There’s been a murder. Everyone is a suspect. The actors on stage. Even you.

Welcome to The Unusual Suspects, an improvised murder mystery comedy.

Throughout the night, the world’s greatest detective will interrogate a cast of unusual characters, from the wacky to the dastardly.

You’ll find yourself face to face with our notorious investigator. Could he be Sherlock, Columbo, Jessica Fletcher? Not exactly. The catch is, no one ever knows which detective will show up.

No one is above suspicion, including you and your guests.

Join us at the hit show that’s played to sold-out audiences for more than three years and counting. This isn’t your standard dinner detective fare; get ready for a wild and funny night that everyone will be talking about the next day, your family, your friends, and maybe even your priest.

The Unusual Suspects is brought to you by the writers and producers of the off-Broadway and national hit: Cuff Me: The Fifty Shades of Grey Musical Parody.

The Unusual Suspects: An Improvised Murder Mystery Comedy

The second Saturday of every month at the Push Comedy Theater

The show starts at 8pm, tickets are $15

The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.

---

The Push Comedy Theater is a 99 seat venue in the heart of Norfolk's brand new Arts District. Founded by local comedy group The Pushers, the Push Comedy Theater is dedicated to bringing you live comedy from the best local and national acts.

The Push Comedy Theater hosts live sketch, improv and stand-up comedy on Friday and Saturday nights. During the week classes are offered in stand-up, sketch and improv comedy as well as acting.

Whether you're a die-hard comedy lover or a casual fan... a seasoned performer or someone who's never stepped foot on stage... the Push Comedy Theater has something for you.

title: Second Saturday Stand-Up
description:
Second Saturday Stand-Up

This once-a-month show is hosted by almost-jaded veteran comic Hatton Jordan who sets the lineup with proven comedians delivering road-tested jokes while they squeeze in new material.

This is NOT a "open mic" .....it's selected talent working on their craft. Every month is a new seasoned lineup.

Every show 90 minutes.

Host: Hatton Jordan

Line up: TBA



Second Saturday Stand-Up

Saturday, September 14th at 10pm

Tickets are $5

title: Norfolk Comedy Festival Fun Pass
description:
Norfolk Comedy Festival Fun Pass
The Norfolk Comedy Festival is almost here!!! This year we are offering a special festival Fun Pass which gets you into all the shows for just $45!!! That's 9 shows, for just $45.

This deal is only available between now and September 17th, so get your Fun Pass today.

Wednesday, September 18th

7pm - Locals Only with Monocle and Faces for Radio: $10

9pm - Locals Only with Lemon Pepper & Sazon and Comickaze: $10

Thursday, September 19th7pm - Locals Only with Sketch Me Outside, The Bright Side and Sketch Me Like One of Your French Girls: $10

9pm - Festival Stand Up Showcase : $8

Friday, September 20th7pm - Sweater Puppies featuring Archer's Amber Nash : $15

9pm - Sketch Comedy with Butcher Stories and Unstoppable Failure : $15

11:30pm - Improv All-Star Jam : $5

Saturday, September 21st

7pm - Sweater Puppies featuring Archer's Amber Nash : $15

9pm - Working Title and Babe : $15

11:30pm - Improv All-Star Jam : $5

This Fun Pass gets you into all shows during the Norfolk Comedy Festival, September 18th through 21st. It does not allow you into any workshops that may be offered during the week.

title: NCF: Locals Only with Monocle and Faces for Radio
description:
Musical Improv + Monocle + Faces for Radio


Monocle
Monocle: The Improvised One-Act Play is a group of five good friends with over 50 years of combined improv & stage experience ready to make you laugh your ass off!

Here's how our show works:We ask the audience for any song lyric (except "Hit me, baby, one more time." Ew.) With that one lyrical suggestion, we will improvise a brand new, never before seen one-act play!

We make up big, funny characters, extravagant sets, & compelling storylines right in front of your eyes. It may be dramatic, maybe even a little tragic, but it's always funny (we are dipshits)!Our show may look like we rehearsed it somehow, but we promise you there is no script. Just lots of laughs & lots of fun!

Comedy! Drama! Spectacle! Monocle!



.

Faces for Radio
Faces for Radio is a comedic live radio play coming out of the Push Comedy Theatre in Norfolk, VA. Members include the vocal talents of Scot Rose and Hilary Stallings and the sound effect stylings of Lindsay Horne. The show is a raunchy and provocative take on Radio Shows from the 30s and 40s; think Saturday Night Live meets the George Burns and Gracie Allen Show.

Originally written wacky characters, slap-stick sound effects and old-school advertisements; Faces for Radio is sure to delight people in their 20s to those born in the 20s. Don’t miss this unique show!

title: NCF: Locals Only with Lemon Pepper + Comickaze
description:
Lemon Pepper & Sazon + Comickaze
Lemon Pepper
We are an all-POC improv and sketch comedy group based in Hampton Roads...we bringing the "flava" to sketch and improv!





.

Comickaze
Co•mic•ka•ze (n)- A group of comedians with explosive humor conducting a deliberate comical crash into an audience.

ComicKaze is the stray puppy of the Push Comedy Theater. Adorable and dirty. Playful and rambunctious. Likely to pee on your floor.Featuring Kasey Kennedy, Austin Johnson, Alex Weller, Patrick C. Taylor, Trip Rumble, and special guests Yasmeen Freightman & Erika Guess, ComicKaze has been making sketch comedy videos for years and made their Push Comedy Theater debut with a winning set in Sketchmageddon.
full_description:
Lemon Pepper & Sazon + Comickaze

Lemon Pepper

We are an all-POC improv and sketch comedy group based in Hampton Roads...we bringing the "flava" to sketch and improv!


.

Comickaze

Co•mic•ka•ze (n)- A group of comedians with explosive humor conducting a deliberate comical crash into an audience.

ComicKaze is the stray puppy of the Push Comedy Theater. Adorable and dirty. Playful and rambunctious. Likely to pee on your floor.
Featuring Kasey Kennedy, Austin Johnson, Alex Weller, Patrick C. Taylor, Trip Rumble, and special guests Yasmeen Freightman & Erika Guess, ComicKaze has been making sketch comedy videos for years and made their Push Comedy Theater debut with a winning set in Sketchmageddon.

title: Harold Night
description:
It's Harold Night at the Push Comedy Theater!

So who the heck is Harold? More accurately the question should be... what the heck is a Harold?

The Harold is the big, bad grand daddy of all long form improv! It starts with an audience suggestion, then improvisers weave together scenes, characters and group games to create a seamless piece. It can be bizarre and magical, baffling and amazing... it definitely needs to be seen.

Harold Night

Free show!!!

The Push Comedy Theater only has 99 seats, so we recommend you get your tickets in advance.



--

title: Locals Only with Bright Side + Sketch Me Like One of Your French Girls
description:
Sketch Me Outside + Bright Side + Sketch Me Like One of Your French Girls
Sketch Me Outside
Sketch Me Outside is a one-man sketch performance written, produced, directed by and starring Keys Wrenn. With a love for strong characters and prop work, SMO aims to entertain from start to finish!



_________________________________________

The Bright Side
The Bright Side is a sketch and improv house team at The Push Comedy Theater in Norfolk, VA. Their comedy is an exuberant celebration of the cruel, absurd world that we live in. Audiences at a Bright Side show can expect to see smart, polished comedy that reflects their optimistic perspectives. Look on The Bright Side!

 

The Bright Side is a sketch & improv comedy group from Norfolk, VA, founded in 2015 by Andrea Bourguignon, Matt Cole, Brian Garraty, and Drew Richard.



_________________________________________

Sketch Me Like One of Your French Girls
Sketch Me Like One of Your French Girls is a sketch comedy group based out of Norfolk, VA. We’re a group of pals who write well together and really know how to pull off a beret.

Sketch Me Outside + Bright Side + Sketch Me Like One of Your French Girls

title: NCF: Sweater Puppies (featuring Archer's Amber Nash)
description:
East Coast Comedy Crew + Sweater Puppies


 
Sweater Puppies (featuring Archer's Amber Nash)

Sweater Puppies are an all-star, all-female team from Atlanta, Georgia. Karen Cassady, Megan Leahy, Whittney Millsap and Amber Nash have worked together for years and finally combined their talents to create new experiences with old clothes. The Sweater Puppies ask audiences to bring in pieces of clothing that are no longer needed, which are used as inspiration for short and long-form shows. After the show, all of the clothing is donated to a deserving charity. A fun show plus a good deed gives everyone a case of the warm and fuzzies!







Amber Nash


Amber has been acting and improvising in Atlanta for 16 years. She is a part of the Improv Ensemble at Dad’s Garage Theatre; fulfilling roles as a performer, teacher, creator and director. Amber trained at IO in Chicago and worked with The Second City at the Alliance Theatre in 2009 and in 2010 about Norwegian Cruise Lines.  Amber is also a voice actor having provided voices for the Adult Swim shows Frisky Dingo and guesting on Aqua Teen Hunger Force. Most of her time today is devoted to providing the voice of Pam Poovey on FX’s hit show Archer. She is married to Kevin Gillese and the two have happily added Carol J. Puppydog to the family.





___________

East Coast Comedy Crew (with The Pushers)

What happens when you take the funniest comedians from Atlanta, Charleston and Hampton Roads?!?  You get the East Coast Comedy Crew.  Led by local comedy giants, The Pushers, have gathered some comedy friends from Theater 99 in Charleston and Dad's Garage in Atlanta for a night of improv comedy.  More special guests to be announced soon.

title: NCF: Sketch Comedy with Butcher Stories and Unstoppable Failure
description:
Sketch Comedy Explosion
Get ready for a night of sketch comedy featuring not one... but two amazing sketch comedy groups.





Unstoppable Failure
Unstoppable Failure is a two-man sketch show that takes a healthy dose of absurdity and slams it against sharp writing.

Comprised of the Brothers Schraeder (A.J. and AL) Unstoppable Failure is a two-man sketch show that takes a healthy dose of absurdity and slams it against sharp satirical writing. They have been official selections at SF Sketchfest, NYC Sketch Festival, Philly Sketchfest, Toronto Sketchfest, Chicago Sketchfest and The North Carolina Comedy Festival. It's members have had worked featured on Cracked.com and LaughExchange (now Payge) and have sold commercial concepts to major brands such as Doritos and Nescafe.



___________________
Butcher Stories featuring Andy Livengood
Based off of the hit blog (www.butcherstories.com) and featuring 100% real interactions with insane customers, Comedian Andy Livengood (Theatre 99, The Christmas Will Be Televised) will take audiences on a hilarious and heartfelt tour of strange coworkers, clueless managers, and crazy customers.

Alex is a directionless twenty year old kid. He spends his days manning a meat counter at the local grocery store. When an unexpected promotion falls into his lap, Alex must decide if he wants to follow his dreams or take on the stable career as a butcher.

What are the guys who cut your steaks really like?Is it possible to deal with customers and not loose your mind? Why is the world of retail so insane?

Find out as Livengood plays over 20 characters to immerse you in the often ridiculous world of retail. Whether you’ve worked behind a service counter or only shopped at one, this show will leave you in stitches.

Butcher Stories: Real stories. Real Customers. Real funny.

“Butcher Stories is well-written and funny, raising the bar when it comes to one man shows.”

-The Post in Courier



Andy Livengood is a writer, actor, and comedian based out of Charleston, SC. He is a graduate of the Theatre 99 improv training program (Charleston, SC) and has studied improv comedy at The Upright Citizen’s Brigade Theatre (NY) and the Annoyance Theatre (Chicago). For almost 15 years Andy has been a Theatre 99 company member, playing with the improv groups, C.H.A.M.P.S., CLUTCH, and Cats Hugging Cats. He has written for the sketch comedy groups Maximum Brain Squad, This is Chucktown, and Your Credit Limit. In 2010 he was voted Charleston’s Best Comic by the readers of the Charleston City Paper. Andy is a regular at “Rip City”comedy shows and “Truth is..” storytelling shows. Andy’s one-man shows, The Christmas Will Be Televised (Winner, Best Play of 2011) and Butcher Stories have been performed in sold out shows up and down the east coast.

Find Andy online at AndyLivengood.com
full_description:
Sketch Comedy Explosion

Get ready for a night of sketch comedy featuring not one... but two amazing sketch comedy groups.



Unstoppable Failure

Unstoppable Failure is a two-man sketch show that takes a healthy dose of absurdity and slams it against sharp writing.

Comprised of the Brothers Schraeder (A.J. and AL) Unstoppable Failure is a two-man sketch show that takes a healthy dose of absurdity and slams it against sharp satirical writing. They have been official selections at SF Sketchfest, NYC Sketch Festival, Philly Sketchfest, Toronto Sketchfest, Chicago Sketchfest and The North Carolina Comedy Festival. It's members have had worked featured on Cracked.com and LaughExchange (now Payge) and have sold commercial concepts to major brands such as Doritos and Nescafe.

___________________

Butcher Stories featuring Andy Livengood

Based off of the hit blog (www.butcherstories.com) and featuring 100% real interactions with insane customers, Comedian Andy Livengood (Theatre 99, The Christmas Will Be Televised) will take audiences on a hilarious and heartfelt tour of strange coworkers, clueless managers, and crazy customers.

Alex is a directionless twenty year old kid. He spends his days manning a meat counter at the local grocery store. When an unexpected promotion falls into his lap, Alex must decide if he wants to follow his dreams or take on the stable career as a butcher.

What are the guys who cut your steaks really like?
Is it possible to deal with customers and not loose your mind? Why is the world of retail so insane?

Find out as Livengood plays over 20 characters to immerse you in the often ridiculous world of retail. Whether you’ve worked behind a service counter or only shopped at one, this show will leave you in stitches.

Butcher Stories: Real stories. Real Customers. Real funny.

“Butcher Stories is well-written and funny, raising the bar when it comes to one man shows.”

-The Post in Courier

Andy Livengood is a writer, actor, and comedian based out of Charleston, SC. He is a graduate of the Theatre 99 improv training program (Charleston, SC) and has studied improv comedy at The Upright Citizen’s Brigade Theatre (NY) and the Annoyance Theatre (Chicago). For almost 15 years Andy has been a Theatre 99 company member, playing with the improv groups, C.H.A.M.P.S., CLUTCH, and Cats Hugging Cats. He has written for the sketch comedy groups Maximum Brain Squad, This is Chucktown, and Your Credit Limit. In 2010 he was voted Charleston’s Best Comic by the readers of the Charleston City Paper. Andy is a regular at “Rip City”comedy shows and “Truth is..” storytelling shows. Andy’s one-man shows, The Christmas Will Be Televised (Winner, Best Play of 2011) and Butcher Stories have been performed in sold out shows up and down the east coast.

Find Andy online at AndyLivengood.com

title: NCF Workshop: Advanced Scenework
description:
Advanced Scenework with Andy Livengood
Great scenes are the building blocks of great longforms. Is there a way to create deeper, more impactful scenes without sacrificing the comedy? Students who take this class will learn techniques to do just that! Students will learn how to create scenes that are worth calling back, characters that are three dimensional, and longforms that deliver both comedically and theatrically. Workshop participants will get scene specific feedback that can be used in all their performances.



Andy Livengood

Andy Livengood wandered into an improv theatre to see a friend’s show and became hooked for life. He is a graduate of the Theatre 99 training program (Charleston, SC) and has studied at the Upright Citizen’s Brigade Theatre (NY) and The Annoyance Theatre (Chicago).

For over a decade he regularly performed and taught at Theatre 99. He was voted Charleston’s Best Comic and has written for the sketch comedy groups Maximum Brain Squad and This is Chucktown. His one man show, The Christmas will be Televised, was voted Best Play in Charleston in 2011 and has been performed in theaters all over the south east.

Workshop: What To Do When You Don't Know What To Do

Saturday, September 21st at the Push Comedy Theater

763 Granby Street, Norfolk

Time: 11am . Cost: $40

title: NCF Workshop: Physical Characters
description:
Physical Characters



Character work is vital to storytelling. How characters behave and why gives context and flavor to the worlds we are building in our improv scenes. If you find yourself often playing yourself or you’re tired of your same wheelhouse of characters, join us for new discovery of characters through the exploration of physicality and emotion.



Whittney Millsap

Whittney Millsap is an actor and improviser, located in Atlanta. She has been an improv company member at Dad's Garage since 2010, where she has performed in many scripted shows and continues to perform improv shows weekly. Whittney can also often be found performing improv with her group, Sweater Puppies


	When she isn't performing or teaching, Whittney is often participating in collaborations with various artist groups, such as Terminus Modern Theatre Ballet and Atlanta Opera. These collaborations often lead to new artistic endeavors, such as the group ImprOper- comprised of improvisers and opera singers- who create completely improvised operas together.
	
	Whittney loves creating, teaching, performing, and continues to pursue her television and film career in Atlanta.
	







Saturday, September 21st at the Push Comedy Theater

763 Granby Street

Time: 2pm .  Cost: $40

title: NCF: Sweater Puppies (featuring Archer's Amber Nash)
description:
East Coast Comedy Crew + Sweater Puppies


 
Sweater Puppies (featuring Archer's Amber Nash)

Sweater Puppies are an all-star, all-female team from Atlanta, Georgia. Karen Cassady, Megan Leahy, Whittney Millsap and Amber Nash have worked together for years and finally combined their talents to create new experiences with old clothes. The Sweater Puppies ask audiences to bring in pieces of clothing that are no longer needed, which are used as inspiration for short and long-form shows. After the show, all of the clothing is donated to a deserving charity. A fun show plus a good deed gives everyone a case of the warm and fuzzies!







Amber Nash


Amber has been acting and improvising in Atlanta for 16 years. She is a part of the Improv Ensemble at Dad’s Garage Theatre; fulfilling roles as a performer, teacher, creator and director. Amber trained at IO in Chicago and worked with The Second City at the Alliance Theatre in 2009 and in 2010 about Norwegian Cruise Lines.  Amber is also a voice actor having provided voices for the Adult Swim shows Frisky Dingo and guesting on Aqua Teen Hunger Force. Most of her time today is devoted to providing the voice of Pam Poovey on FX’s hit show Archer. She is married to Kevin Gillese and the two have happily added Carol J. Puppydog to the family.





___________

East Coast Comedy Crew (with The Pushers)

What happens when you take the funniest comedians from Atlanta, Charleston and Hampton Roads?!?  You get the East Coast Comedy Crew.  Led by local comedy giants, The Pushers, have gathered some comedy friends from Theater 99 in Charleston and Dad's Garage in Atlanta for a night of improv comedy.  More special guest to be announced soon.

Sweater Puppies are an all-star, all-female team from Atlanta, Georgia. The Sweater Puppies ask audiences to bring in pieces of clothing that are no longer needed, which are used as inspiration for short and long-form shows. After the show, all of the clothing is donated to a deserving charity. A fun show plus a good deed gives everyone a case of the warm and fuzzies!

More special guest to be announced soon.

title: NCF: BABE + Working Title
description:
BABE + Working Title!
_________

BABE
BABE starts with a single (middle) grounded scene, establishing the who/what/where, then jump to a different side of the stage to create a tangential scene with a whole new group of characters, and then jumping to the other side of the stage to do this once more. Throughout the show they will be jumping back and forth in these different "dimensions" to eventually pull them all together in one scene. How will they get there? No one knows.

BABE is an improv duo who creates multiple dimensions of weird characters and situations to jump back and forth to throughout the show. Time is a flat circle.





Working Title
Working Title is a two person long form improv show featuring Archer's Amber Nash and her adorable sidekick (AKA husband) Kevin Gillese as they create a screenplay based off of audience suggestions in about 60 minutes. Gillese always plays the main character which leaves Nash playing every other character in the story, part of the joy is watching this virtuoso improv comedian bouncing around seamlessly from character to character. This show was originally inspired by the screenwriting manual "Save The Cat" and has toured across Europe and the United States. The most recent touring engagements include Portland, OR, the Amsterdam Improv Festival and Cincinatti Improv Festival.

BABE + Working Title!

_________

BABE

BABE starts with a single (middle) grounded scene, establishing the who/what/where, then jump to a different side of the stage to create a tangential scene with a whole new group of characters, and then jumping to the other side of the stage to do this once more. Throughout the show they will be jumping back and forth in these different "dimensions" to eventually pull them all together in one scene. How will they get there? No one knows.

BABE is an improv duo who creates multiple dimensions of weird characters and situations to jump back and forth to throughout the show. Time is a flat circle.


Working Title

Working Title is a two person long form improv show featuring Archer's Amber Nash and her adorable sidekick (AKA husband) Kevin Gillese as they create a screenplay based off of audience suggestions in about 60 minutes. Gillese always plays the main character which leaves Nash playing every other character in the story, part of the joy is watching this virtuoso improv comedian bouncing around seamlessly from character to character. title: The Improvised Fairy Tale: A Kid Friendly Comedy Show
description:
You are cordially invited to join the Brothers and Sisters Grimm as they create an “Improvised Fairy Tale.”  Tales of daring feats, magic spells, and funny characters will be made up on the spot using your suggestions. This family-friendly event will feature a never to be seen again improvised story at the Push Comedy Theater the last Sunday of every month. Children in costume get in for free!“The Improvised Fairy Tale” is part of the Children’s Programming available at Push Comedy Theater and is produced by The Brothers and Sisters Grimm.  The performers are made up of a rotating cast of improvisers that train and perform at Push Comedy Theater.

Children will be welcome to meet the cast in their costumes after the show.
full_description:
You are cordially invited to join the Brothers and Sisters Grimm as they create an “Improvised Fairy Tale.” Tales of daring feats, magic spells, and funny characters will be made up on the spot using your suggestions. This family-friendly event will feature a never to be seen again improvised story at the Push Comedy Theater the last Sunday of every month. Children in costume get in for free!

“The Improvised Fairy Tale” is part of the Children’s Programming available at Push Comedy Theater and is produced by The Brothers and Sisters Grimm. The performers are made up of a rotating cast of improvisers that train and perform at Push Comedy Theater.

Children will be welcome to meet the cast in their costumes after the show.
